meanings.definition: A small item kept in memory of the person who gave it or originally owned it.
meanings.sent1: My grandmother's locket is a cherished keepsake from her youth.
meanings.sent2: She treasured the old watch as a keepsake of her grandfather.
meanings.sent3: The keepsake from the vacation made her smile every time she saw it.
meanings.sent4: The worn-out teddy bear became a keepsake of their childhood adventures.
meanings.sent5: The faded photograph served as a keepsake of their long-lasting friendship.

meanings.definition: Something kept or given to be kept as a memento.
meanings.sent1: The seashell she found on the beach became a keepsake of their summer vacation.
meanings.sent2: He kept the concert ticket as a keepsake of the unforgettable night.
meanings.sent3: The keepsake of the lost bet made everyone laugh at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a keepsake of the joy she brought to others.
meanings.sent5: The old journal was a keepsake of her thoughts and memories.
